# Legacy customizations

**API Collection**

Customize appearance information directly on the toolbar object.

## Overview

In iOS 13 and later, customize your toolbar using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar/standardAppearance] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar/compactAppearance] properties. You may continue to use these legacy accessors to customize your toolbar’s appearance directly, but you must update the appearance for different bar configurations yourself.

## Setting the bar’s style

- **barStyle**: The toolbar style that specifies its appearance.
- **UIBarStyle**: Defines the stylistic appearance of different types of views.

## Configuring bar button items

- **tintColor**: The tint color to apply to the bar button items.

## Changing the background

- **barTintColor**: The tint color to apply to the toolbar background.
- **backgroundImage(forToolbarPosition:barMetrics:)**: Returns the image to use for the background in a given position and with given metrics.
- **setBackgroundImage(_:forToolbarPosition:barMetrics:)**: Sets the image to use for the background in a given position and with given metrics.

## Adding a shadow

- **shadowImage(forToolbarPosition:)**: Returns the image to use for the toolbar shadow in a given position.
- **setShadowImage(_:forToolbarPosition:)**: Sets the image to use for the toolbar shadow in a given position.

## Customizing appearance

- **standardAppearance**: The appearance settings to use for a standard-height toolbar.
- **compactAppearance**: The appearance settings to use for a compact-height toolbar.
- **scrollEdgeAppearance**: The appearance settings for a standard-height toolbar when the edge of scrollable content aligns with the edge of the toolbar.
- **compactScrollEdgeAppearance**: The appearance settings for a compact-height toolbar when the edge of any scrollable content aligns with the edge of a compact-height toolbar.
- **isTranslucent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar is translucent.
